meanings.definition: A crystalline compound with a single six-membered ring structure, found in nucleic acids.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the pyrimidines under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: Nucleic acids contain pyrimidines like cytosine and thymine.
meanings.sent3: The pyrimidines threw a party in the DNA strand.
meanings.sent4: The pyrimidines in the genetic code are like the bricks in a building.
meanings.sent5: The pyrimidines sparkled like tiny crystals in the cell.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of organic compounds with a similar structure, including cytosine, thymine, and uracil.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are researching the effects of pyrimidines on DNA replication.
meanings.sent2: Cytosine, thymine, and uracil are examples of pyrimidines.
meanings.sent3: The pyrimidines had a race to see who could pair up first in the DNA strand.
meanings.sent4: In the story of genetics, pyrimidines are the colorful characters.
meanings.sent5: The pyrimidines danced together in perfect harmony within the cell.
